subject: Nutrition
title: The Agricultural Revolution
description: Learn The Agricultural Revolution in one minute.

hook.text: About 12,000 years ago, humans stopped roaming and started farming. Everything about food changed.

buildup.text: Agriculture allowed populations to grow by providing reliable calories from wheat, rice, and corn.

discovery.text: But farming narrowed the diet dramatically. Instead of hundreds of plants, people depended on one or two.

twist.text: Skeletons from early farmers show worse nutritionâ€”shorter stature, more anemia, and more cavities.

climax.text: Farming didn't make individuals healthier. It made civilizations possible at a personal nutritional cost.

punchline.text: Farming fed more people but nourished them less.

quiz.question: What happened to health when humans switched to farming?
